title: Indian Spiced Onions Recipe
description: This spicy onion relish is served with papadums at Indian restaurants and easily made at home with ketchup, chili, sugar, fenugreek, and cilantro.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Appetizers and Snacks Spicy Indian Spiced Onions 3.3 (8) 8 Reviews 4 Photos Spicy onions just like the ones served in Indian restaurants as a side dish! Delicious served with crispy papadums as a starter for any Indian meal. Submitted by CELTICFANMAN Updated on September 2, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 4 4 Prep Time: 5 mins Additional Time: 1 day Total Time: 1 day 5 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 1 onion, chopped 2 teaspoons ketchup 1 teaspoon lemon juice 1 tablespoon white sugar 1 teaspoon chopped fresh cilantro 1 teaspoon chopped fresh fenugreek leaves 1 teaspoon chili powder 1 pinch salt Directions Stir together onion and ketchup in a medium bowl until onion is thinly and evenly coated. Mix in lemon juice. Stir in sugar, cilantro, fenugreek, chili powder, and salt until well combined. Cover and chill in the refrigerator for 24 hours to let the lemon juice neutralize the onion flavor slightly. Add Your Photo Photos of Indian Spiced Onions 01 of 04 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 04 Photo by  PurpleStraw1930 12/12/2022 I used vinegar, tomato paste, and paprika to add colour & flavour, and then a few pinches of salt and brown sugar to balance it out. Looks good, smells good, tastes good, really easy to make. 03 of 04 Photo by  James 01/06/2021 I served this with a tandoori chicken dish and everyone liked it. I do suggest letting it sit in frig over night. 1 You’ll Also Love Crispy Vegetable Pakoras 114 Ratings Air Fryer Onion Bhaji 4 Ratings Gobi Aloo (Indian Style Cauliflower with Potatoes) 218 Ratings Indian Relish 126 Ratings Sambar - Spicy Indian Curry 2 Ratings Traditional Chicken Curry 34 Ratings Baked Onion Bhajis 6 Ratings Authentic Saag Paneer 153 Ratings Lasooni Murgh (Garlic Flavored Spicy Chicken) 12 Ratings Vegetable Masala 92 Ratings Air Fryer Pakoras 10 Ratings Spicy Chicken Curry 43 Ratings Cabbage Curry 33 Ratings Aloo Phujia 459 Ratings Tomato Onion Koora 5 Ratings Chickpea Curry 647 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: CELTICFANMAN
instructions: Stir together onion and ketchup in a medium bowl until onion is thinly and evenly coated. Mix in lemon juice. Stir in sugar, cilantro, fenugreek, chili powder, and salt until well combined. Cover and chill in the refrigerator for 24 hours to let the lemon juice neutralize the onion flavor slightly.
